head.supplied: ¶ [Director states that Forest Inspr ¶ William Ferguson. ¶ ¶ has forwarded his Report to the Lands Dept] ¶ In M to James McCulloch, 15 June 1871, M complained that the 'Forest Inspector' was corresp...

div.p: No. 9496, vol. 1871 Z, VPRS 1168/P inward correspondence registers, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Letter not found; item is a register entry only, registered on 27 July 1871.
[Director states that Forest Inspr
William Ferguson.
has forwarded his Report to the Lands Dept]
In M to James McCulloch, 15 June 1871, M complained that the 'Forest Inspector' was corresponding directly with thegovernment. Ferguson evidently submitted his report direct, rather than through Mto whom he was technically responsible. In W. Odgers to M, 27 July 1871 (in this edition as 71-07-21b),M was told Ferguson's report had been returned and Ferguson told 'to forward it in the regular official manner'. The report wasre-submitted to the Chief Secretary's Office on 1 August,presumably by M,but no covering letter from M has been found. It was referred to the Crown Lands office on 9July1871.Ferguson appears to have questioned the necessity of corresponding through M, for on1 Augusthe wrote to the Chief Secretary 'with refce to mode of transmission of his Report' (No. 9734, vol. 1871 Z, VPRS 1168, Public Record Office, Victoria).
